website_summaries.verdict: While not as lightweight as the original Kindle Oasis, the larger screen, more durable aluminum chassis and full waterproofing are important upgrades that put the new Oasis at the top of the e-reader class.
pros: The new Kindle Oasis maintains its slim design while adding a sturdier aluminum back and a larger 7-inch, high-resolution E Ink screen
It's fully waterproof (can be submerged) and can play your Audible audiobooks to Bluetooth headphones or speakers
Integrated light is brighter at its highest setting

customer_reviews.title: Oasis II - Great Expectations Dashed Twice
customer_reviews.text: Great Expectations Dashed - And Compounded by poor customer service. When we returned to US from International trip we requested help again regarding this "Lemon" of a $350.00 32 G Wifi/Cell. To-day Amazon provided their solution an we received an "All New Oasis" which turned out to be a poorly boxed refurbished unit. A brand new top of the line $350.00 Oasis malfunctions out of the box and Amazon thinks a refurbished unit is a suitable replacement - it is not!!! I have escalated and will update on Amazon's further "customer service". Original Problem - brand new $350.00 Oasis Kindle. 4 hours reading on Airplane Mode and the battery is dead. Recharged same again.
customer_reviews.author: Shipdoc

customer_reviews.title: Lasts only a few hours.
customer_reviews.text: Not as advertised, it lasts about 3 hours. I sent it back and got a nice email explaining that they updated to the newest software. Great, can’t see a difference. The problem is battery life. You cannot read for an afternoon without a recharge. The battery discharges in about 3 hours. A very expensive reader that won’t come close to the stated performance. My HD 10 has a better battery! Buy a cheaper reader, save money, and get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Hearn

customer_reviews.title: Love this reader but battery life is horrible
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this reader. However, the battery life is so bad that I am going to need to carry a charger with me everywhere. This thing only lasts about twice as long as my iPad Air running the kindle app. I am considering returning this device and getting a reader with better battery life. Also, for a $350 purchase price Amazon did not even include a charger, just the cable. No charger, no cover, horrible battery life..... I just don’t feel that this device is worth anywhere close to the price I paid.
customer_reviews.author: Von A. Cooley

customer_reviews.title: Poor battery life
customer_reviews.text: The whole reason I went to a kindle oasis was the ability to only charge once a month. So far, I have had to charge it every day even in airplane mode. This is totally unacceptable. Furthermore, the whispersync does not work. I have been a fan of the kindle and bought my first generation kindle pre-order. This is a major step backwards. Pros. Incredibly lightweight. Love the screen. Cons. Battery life and poor whispersync
customer_reviews.author: K. Ellsworth-Evans

customer_reviews.title: Now, this is love...
customer_reviews.text: I'm officially in love! Got my Kindle about a week ago and I love it! It fits great in my palm; I love the rotation ability since I am always switching hands makes it comfortable In both hands. I love the large screen and the fact that its waterproof since I'm a bath reader and live by the beach. I have owned the Kindle Voyage, Kindle Paperwhite and the Nook color, and Nook classic. By far this is my favorite e-reader. I bought a decal for it by decalgirl, and it fits just right with my kindle leather case. I haven't tried the audible yet but I will soon! I would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Danie

customer_reviews.title: PRetty good, but a few disappointments
customer_reviews.text: I traded in a Kindle Paperwhite. This is a pretty good replacement. Two disappointments so far. 1. The top of the line and it doesn' support WIFI 5GHz and AC. Only 2.4GHz and BGN. 2. MY previous Kindles, there have been a couple, presented the collections first, followed by books not in any collection. That's, of course, what happens when you download a new book. The Oasis doesn't seem to do that, or at least I can't figure out how to change the display to do that. I do like the size and the buttons for changing pages. That's nice.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Q. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Update on: Battery life has tanked
customer_reviews.text: I had no issues for five months. Now it doesn’t hold a charge for more than a few of hours. Device (32 GB with LTE) Update: Resetting the device seems to have fixed the problem. I was impressed that Amazon support called me on Friday and left a message wanting more information on my original post. I love my Oasis. It goes everywhere I do, so was very concerned about the battery issue I had, especially after reading posts here and on other sites about the problem. Al good now!
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: A FEW WORDS ON MY NEW KINDLE OASIS...[ one month old]
customer_reviews.text: My fifth kindle, the Oasis is a superb reading machine. However. There are many bells and whistles which I will never use. [think A BOOK IS A BOOK. Not a whiz-bang glitzy das machina...] The best Kindle was my DX, because of overall size. One caveat: The OASIS does suffer with very short battery charge... Hey AMAZON Kindle dept...when will you be producing a Oasis DX sized Kindle ????? [I still buy printed books. And have a very large hard back books library...collectibles, fiction; non-fiction as well as a sizeable research library...[Avionics, history, art and war....and more.]
customer_reviews.author: Robert P. von Fischbach

customer_reviews.title: Battery information is off
customer_reviews.text: I like the fact that it has the page turn buttons witch cuts down on fingertips on the screen The only thing I dislike is that it claims to have an 8 hour battery life with a single charge and that’s accurate maybe 6 if you’re lucky my guess is that is because of the screen changes based on lighting the good news is that it has a fast change even if you are still reading it might only take 5 minutes less if it’s off
customer_reviews.author: STTIM

customer_reviews.title: Getting Better
customer_reviews.text: I love this new Kindle Oasis. It's a bit heavier than the previous version of Kindle Oasis, but not by much. The aluminum could feel cold, but I got decals from Skinomi so it helps get rid of the coldness and protect the back of Oasis from getting scratched. The Audiobook from Audible works great. I wish I could read and listen at the same time--like with the Kindle App for Android and iOS. Maybe Amazon could implement that with the next software update. It's only been a few days, and so far everything goes well. The bigger screen is sharp, and I like the auto-brightness feature. Overall, I think it's a great update for the Kindle Oasis line. Yay!
customer_reviews.author: Toddy

customer_reviews.title: Connecting with my old kindle
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed that I was not able to connect it to my old kindle fire to transfer already purchased books. I really wanted this kindle because I could read while I was in the pool. Unfortunately Amazon chat told Me they forced the connection but I still did not have my books in the oasis. It was a birthday gift so I ended up returning it. 😩😩😩😩😳
customer_reviews.author: lupe perez

customer_reviews.title: Not much change
customer_reviews.text: I like the larger size. I traded the first edition on this purchase. Battery life is very superior on the first gen oasis. I always had extra power. I have always recharged nightly. I read about 4 to 5 hours daily. New oasis is down to 39% most nights. I do not have a problem with that. I just expected more. With the exception of the larger size I would have stayed with my old oasis. I started with the first kindle and have updated each new edition. I kept my voyage model as a backup
customer_reviews.author: B. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Can’t read and use the Audible app at the same time.  I’m back to using my iPad again.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t support immersion reading. You can’t read and play the audible narration at the same time. I can do that on my iPad and iPhone, but not on this. A big mistake by the design team. I was upgrading from a Paperwhite, but I see no real reason to do so.
customer_reviews.author: T. Robbins

customer_reviews.title: It’s Not bad
customer_reviews.text: It is nice, it is much improved but still a lot of flaws. One is their cover , don’t buy it the magnets are so weak the Kindle falls out...or at least try it and send it back..I waited too long...Also when I am reading if I happen to just touch the side..not the page..the side...it turns a page...it has great color and is nicer then the last one, but I’m not sure it is worth the price
customer_reviews.author: Windwish

customer_reviews.title: Entry into the E-reader game was worth waiting for this...
customer_reviews.text: I am a latecomer to the e-reader game. Waiting for the Oasis made the wait worthwhile. Elegant construction, crisp display, long battery life. Lighweigh, water-resistant and intuitive interface. No-cost reading available via my county public library (in addition to titles that can be purchased --or are otherwise available-- from Amazon. Love the word selection and definition function and really love the passage selection option with direct delivery to social media (Twitter, in my case). If you've been waiting for your e-reader entry, this is the tool that can end your wait. Select with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Long-Suffering Technology Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Boot up and Battery
customer_reviews.text: For $350.00 I expected a near perfect product. The design is great and I really like holding it and of course reading with it. Where I am really disappointed is with the battery life which is no where near as advertised and the failure of the the reader to boot up and resume where I have left off. This is becoming more frequent as time goes on. When I did need support I was hooked up in India. That kind of support brought back horror stories from my years old dealing with Dell Computers. The bottom line is that I expect more, much more from Amazon on this product.
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn

customer_reviews.title: The New more powerful Oasis
customer_reviews.text: I was happy with the Voyage but with so many improvements I thought I should get the latest Oasis. I began using this one as soon as it arrived. I’m trying to get used to holding it vertically without accidentally turning a page. My hand may be a little small for the button placement. I also chose the ragged edge for the end of the line which really makes it seem like a paperback. I have % read on the right and page number on the left. That is neat. Thank you for my 10th kindle. It is much improved, and I haven’t even tried Audible yet.
customer_reviews.author: Reader

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Cost
customer_reviews.text: Well pleased. Recharges very quickly, font & print size easily adjustable. Worth the higher cost if you read a lot. Only problem, has pictures of book cover instead of only title. In a way this is great.. helps remember the book. My old Kindle Keyboard had the books in a list. So now if I have bought a series... I have to make a paper list to know which is #1 # 2 etc. The only other problem is the charger cord is So Short...Finally plugged it in behind a small bookcase & brought the cord around to the lowest shelf. I enjoy the free 3G in addition to using WiFi...if you are traveling 3G keeps it usable.
customer_reviews.author: MLD

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, I was a little turned off by the shape when I first received it - it's much more square than a normal book. That said, I completely forgot about that within the first hour of reading. It gives enough room on the side to hold it comfortably without having to worry about infringing on the screen/your reading space. If you like using e-readers, get this. If you are an avid reader, and are considering getting an e-reader, get this. If you're an avid reader, but prefer real books to e-readers, consider getting this anyway. The only thing you might miss is the smell of a book, but you won't regret this e-reader.
customer_reviews.author: Bryce

customer_reviews.title: Perfect eReader, Worth Every $$$
customer_reviews.text: I've had a Kindle Fire HD 6 for five years and absolutely loved it. It's still in great shape and works like a charm, so this wasn't a purchase out of any real necessity -- but I'm so glad I got this. This is the most delightful reader I could have imagined. While the shape looked odd at first (it's even more dramatic than it seems in the picture), it's actually the perfect curve for holding and sits really nicely in my hand. It was definitely worth springing for the blue textured cover for protection when I'm not reading.
customer_reviews.author: G. Whieldon

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable for left-handed reading
customer_reviews.text: I honestly wish I hadn't bought this. The thicker depth on one side makes for an uncomfortable left-handed reading experience. I've not be able to lose myself in reading in bed because it doesn't fit right. I gave away my Kindle Paperwhite when I bought the Oasis, and now am faced with paying another $200+ to re-buy one. I love Kindles and have owned them since they first came out. The Oasis is a step backwards.
customer_reviews.author: Relentless Shrew

customer_reviews.title: Product does not live up to advertising- disappointing & not worth cost.
customer_reviews.text: I love the fact that this ereader can hold thousands of books. I would give a negative rating for battery life -sent one reader back already & might send the second one back for same issue. Have taken the reader out of case to see if that contributes to battery drain. I have to charge the reader daily or battery runs out - disputes amazon’s claim that the battery life lasts “months”!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Hostler

customer_reviews.title: If you deregister your kindle to avoid others having access, DON'T BUY THE OASIS!
customer_reviews.text: The moment you disconnect this device from Amazon, it wipes it clean! I love the fact I can download books and then disconnect my Kindle to avoid others having access... especially when I am traveling. You cannot power your Oasis all the way off either. You can power it down to the resting power, but you CANNOT power it all the way off! These are deal killers for me. Regretfully I didn't realize this within my first 30 days... I now own a very expensive paperweight.
customer_reviews.author: Sid

customer_reviews.title: Repeating what others say about POOR battery life
customer_reviews.text: VERY disappointed that battery life is about 5-7 days. Even with turning to airline mode after each download (daily newspaper), the battery won't last a week. Screen quality is OK, but no better than the latest PaperWhite. I made a big mistake spending $349 for this....
customer_reviews.author: C. Braithwaite

customer_reviews.title: Great, but...
customer_reviews.text: Battery life is not great. I wish there was an easy way to turn it off. The top button only allows you to ‘cancel’, ‘restart’ or ‘screen off’. Maybe if I could easily turn it off between readings, it would last longer. The rest of it is wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Cherrin

customer_reviews.title: software glitches
customer_reviews.text: Like the size, display, and weight. Had problems with the first one sent, the page buttons stopped working usually around ten minutes of reading, also page highlights came on by itself and was hard to turn off, sometimes unit started go on then off by itself. sent it back for a replacement and new one is doing the same thing but not as bad. I should send it back but no sense in getting a replacement. trying to decide what to do. Finally sent it back. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: nick shaieb

customer_reviews.title: $350 and less than 2 years later - wont reboot, stuck on screensaver
customer_reviews.text: Limited use, only by the pool or beach. Today it won’t reboot, won’t unfreeze, start button does nothing. Green charge light comes on but cannot use it. Disappointing after less than 2 years of limited utilization. Amazon - your product should last longer than this. I would not recommend this Kindle. Update: after over an hour “chatting” with amazon support, and two difference representatives asking me to press the volume buttons, this is a book reading device that doesn’t have volume buttons, their best advice was to take it to Best Buy and see if they can fix it. Keep in mind I bought this online from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: amazon reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth it to me.
customer_reviews.text: I love the larger size screen. However, it needs to be charged ALL the time. Probably related to the cover not having a battery in it. I do not feel that it is as easy to navigate as the original oasis. Not being able to use a regular headset, but needing a Bluetooth set is disappointing as Bluetooth uses more battery power. Also not being able to listen and read at same time. I am disappointed in this reader which I was very excited to see be available r/t the screen size, audio like the first kindle and being waterproof so that pool/beach use would be safer. As the box was burned I am stuck with this.
customer_reviews.author: searching

customer_reviews.title: Rad
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from an older paperwhite model. There are improvements to screen size, touch screen functionality, that nice grip thing with the buttons, automatic screen brightness, etc. Only downgrade is that this all comes with a price--the battery. Battery life is noticeably reduced, but all the features make up for it. I find myself charging the Oasis probably once every two weeks, vs. the couple months that would go by on the old paperwhite before I noticed it needed a charge. Maybe I'm just reading more. Overall, good experience, would recommend for ebook fans.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Kindle Oasis lives up to its promise except it requires recharging often
customer_reviews.text: What I like the most is the 3G feature that allows me to get books whenever i choose and wherever I am. It is very light weight and comfortable in my hands. The WiFi for listening is wonderful; not being tethered to the Kindle gives great freedom. What I dislike most is that it constantly has to be recharged. I thought from reading the description that the charge would last longer than my newest Fire but that is not the case
customer_reviews.author: Lynda

customer_reviews.title: Oasis is a winner....and I have had all Kindle models!
customer_reviews.text: I have had most models of the Kindle from the very first version! I thought nothing could compare with my Paperwhite. But I love the ergonomic feel of this Oasis! When reading, I take it out of the protective case I purchased so I can use the groove on the back for easier holding. I love how this one provides the option of using page turn buttons along with the options of swiping or tapping the page to progress. Also love how it uses Audible books! I had never gotten into Audible, as I truly prefer reading. However, I am enjoying using it for celebrity memoirs when the celebrity reads their own book to you! Oasis has not disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kindled

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with the Oasis 2!
customer_reviews.text: I tried and returned (twice) the original Kindle Oasis. My biggest issue with the original Oasis was splotchy and uneven lighting. The lighting on my new Kindle Oasis 2 model is virtually perfect. It is nice having the larger screen on the Oasis 2, but it does come at the price of a larger device which doesn’t fit as easily into my pocket and is noticeably heavier. Trade offs like these are unavoidable, but with the Oasis 2 I do think Amazon has finally hit the e-reader sweet spot. So five stars from me.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie S

customer_reviews.title: Great! Plus, an easy way to make it non-slip
customer_reviews.text: A great upgrade to the first generation Oasis. They seemed to have kept the good features and added quality upgrades. In order to deal with the slippery body, I ordered two 5”x7” sheets of Talon Grip material (normally used to add customized grippiness to a pistol). It is super thin, super sticky, and made to be cut. I cut one sheet to make the back grippy, and a small strip to make the glass above and below the buttons grippy. (See attached photos). Now it’s perfect (I could have made straighter cuts, granted). This is similar in result to using gaff tape, but I like this look better.
customer_reviews.author: 843charlie

customer_reviews.title: Falls way short of expectations
customer_reviews.text: My second go-round, thinking things had improved. No. I called support seeking answers primarily involving battery life. Ads promise "weeks" of use without recharging, and the unit was draining much faster than paperwhite or voyage, and this is what I was told to do to maintain battery life for the advertised specification: 1. Dim my screen 2. Turn off wifi 3. (best of all) ONLY USE DEVICE FOR 1/2 HOUR A DAY.
customer_reviews.author: KasaC

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Device
customer_reviews.text: What a difference an inch makes (Go ahead, finish with your own punchline, I’ll wait...)! Seriously though, the bigger screen makes a world of difference and it’s a real beauty. I usually hold it with two hands, which sounds not so ideal, but is really not a problem. It’s a pleasure to hold. My only suggestion for an improvement would be some sort of a matte finish along the black border. It’s fairly slippery as is. And the aluminum case is is nice, plush touch. The waterproofing is just icing on the cake. I haven’t tried the Audible feature yet, but I like that it’s there. LOVE this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Dr DogBalls

customer_reviews.title: If you're fine with the Kindle you have, you don't need the Oasis
customer_reviews.text: My Kindle Voyage was literally coming apart at the seams and Amazon no longer makes the Voyage so I had to purchase the Oasis. I like the Voyage more - it's smaller and lighter. If you're satisfied with the Kindle you have, skip the Oasis. If you're a fan of audible books, the Oasis will play them. If you read in the bathtub or on the beach, the Oasis is waterproof although I wonder if it would survive a full fall into the bath. The Oasis is advertised to be clearer and sharper than the Voyage but I compared them side by side and I couldn't tell the difference.
customer_reviews.author: Suncoast

customer_reviews.title: Support not up to same Amazon standards that I usually get for regular everyday orders.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered on March 17, 2018, worked GREAT for 17 months (until mid August 2019). Then it started not holding a charge as long, and taking longer to charge. Until now, 18 months after purchase, it is completely dead and will not even take a charge or turn on when plugged in. I'm unhappy at the ability to get assistance online, I never got through the FAQ loops to even get to an online chat. I tried all the suggested fixes in FAQ's, but no success. I'd love to get it repaired (if possible) but have no idea how, or where. VERY disappointed in support for this product.
customer_reviews.author: WRS

customer_reviews.title: Battery doesn't last very long.
customer_reviews.text: better than previous version - more font size options etc.; however, the battery does not last very long - even in standby. certainly not the "weeks" claimed in the product information. It lasts longest, of course, when i put it in airplane mode, which i do whenever i am reading (don't need to sync or download).
customer_reviews.author: schnoop

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I have had Kindles for years. I ruled out the Oasis when it first came out because the battery seemed big and bulky. I use my Kindle mostly at home and would charge every few weeks if not longer. I didn't need the bigger battery. Funny that when they release a water-resistant one I buy it and it has the worst battery of any Kindle I have had. Not even a full month and charging for it's fourth time. Grrrrrrr.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany S

customer_reviews.title: Loading and setting to my preferences a little tricky, but very happy overall.
customer_reviews.text: This was my sixth Kindle. I prefer to keep my books on the Kindle itself, rather than in the cloud. Transferring my books each time I get a new Kindle is annoying, and the lack of ability to do it easily is a pain. Now that I have everything transferred and set up to my preferences I am very happy with my new Kindle. Hopefully I won't hit maximum capacity, like I did on my previous Oasis, for a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: I had the Oasis a week & the location part at the bottom didn’t work. I called support & when they couldn’t fix it, they said they’d send out another. I received a refurbished one, I called & was told that was their policy. After speaking with a supervisor, he sent out a new one. And I had to return yet another Oasis. This one works okay but am not impressed with the battery life. At the cost of the Oasis, I thought it would be better.
customer_reviews.author: Bjwags

customer_reviews.title: Be careful what you order!
customer_reviews.text: This has been a nightmare. I received the oasis and it was defective. One would think that something like this will be checked before it was shipped. But no it didn’t work and now I have to wait until January 19 for another one to be shipped. In the meantime I was trading in my Kindle paperwhite and Amazon cannot extend the timeline. So I will be charged back for that which is ridiculous. I’m still trying to decide if I should just cancel the whole darn thing. A few calls to Amazon Support was another nightmare because no one can do anything.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Good Book, Bad Battery
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this book in January and it is now September, i love this book don't get me wrong however I have a major issue with my battery (in airplane mode) draining my battery down to 17% within 5 hours and not all of that is reading. I have been having an issue with this happening for a couple of weeks now.I love my Kindle I just wish the battery would last longer than 9 months.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Audible with Kindle Oasis is NOT the same as Audible/Kindle with iPhone/iPad
customer_reviews.text: Just received Kindle Oasis which was advertised as "Audible included". Audible on Kindle IS ONLY computer generated speech. Audible in Kindle is NOT author/human narration, as I have come to appreciate while listening with Audible & reading a Kindle book simultaneously on my iPhone or iPad. Audible & Kindle work as one and at the same time on my iPhone/iPad. Text being narrated is highlighted simultaneously with narration. This is a very cool feature, but alas Kindle Oasis does not provide it. Using the term/name "Audible" in connection to Kindle Oasis is FALSE advertising. Correct description should be "Text to Speech". Very disappointed as thinking Kindle would now work like my iPhone/iPad was the main reason I purchased Kindle Oasis.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Casey

customer_reviews.title: Call Me Convinced
customer_reviews.text: I have owned a number of Kindles, including the Voyage which I deemed to be the best screen of the bunch. Until I bought the Oasis 2 gen. It is a better ereader. The increased page sized makes a huge difference in terms of immersion in the book. Yes, the Oasis screen is a softer white than the bluish white of the Voyage but they are similarly legible in bright light or dim rooms using the backlight. It is awfully expensive. If you like to read and read a lot, spoil yourself.
customer_reviews.author: jpm

customer_reviews.title: Makes reading so much easier.....
customer_reviews.text: I have had three previous Kindles. This particular one is my favorite because it is a lot lighter, easier to hold and I like the wider dimension of the screen. The buttons to turn the pages are preferable to me. I love my new Kindle. I hesitated to order it, given the expense. I have a chronic disease that makes reading a hard cover book very difficult. Kindle has enabled me to continue reading with much less trouble and exhaustion. I did get a cover for it, and do like having a cover on the Kindle.
customer_reviews.author: Nellie's mom

customer_reviews.title: An upgrade from Kindle Paperwhite
customer_reviews.text: I had been using a Kindle Paperwhite. When I saw the previous generation (9th) on sale with 32gb storage and cellular connectivety, I decided it was too good of a deal to pass up. While I had not exhausted the storage on my 4gb Kindle, I do appreciate not having to wory about it with 32gb now. The best feature that I enjoy are the page turn buttons. They work flawlessly. Occasionally I had to swipe a few times to turn the pages on the Kindle. All-in-all, for the sale price that I paid, the Oasis is an upgrade over the paperwhite.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: oasis review
customer_reviews.text: First, I always pay the extra to get rid of ads and have wifi forever. It would be nice if it came with a small speaker embedded in case the bluetooth isn't around. Also would like just a little color. Not intense but a small amount like in vintage books of the early 1900's. The resolution is great, overall it's a great improvement from past models. I love being able to read in the sunlight or late at night comfortably....or be read to when busy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I like the original Oasis better
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, my original Oasis (which I loved dearly) got crushed. I don't like this new one. It is too big, the 6" was perfect to fit in my small purse. I also do not like the fact that it does not have a charging cover. I understand that the new version has longer battery life, but for me the security of a 'back-up" battery was invaluable. I would be out, and if I got a message that the cover needed to be charged, I still had the battery life in the device itself to use until I could get to charge it. Now I won't have any warning.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: An Improvement Over the Original Oasis -- with an Unpleasant Finish Issue
customer_reviews.text: The larger display on this Kindle is wonderful. The finish of the case -- eh, not so wonderful. In particular the edges of the case where the aluminum mates with the display itself is uncomfortably sharp -- to the point I think you could cut yourself if you were holding the Kindle firmly and somebody pulled it from your hand. As it is, it's somewhat uncomfortable to hold, especially because this unit is distinctly heavier than the original Oasis. The manufacturing process really needs to add a fillet to that edge of the case. Battery life is fantastic so far, especially when compared to the original Oasis when not attached to the battery case.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Hargrove

customer_reviews.title: Edges Are a Problem
customer_reviews.text: The new Oasis 2 hits most of the desired points many readers have been requesting - screen size and clarity, battery in the unit rather than dependent on a cover, waterproofing, audiobook capability, etc. However, my new Oasis is very uncomfortable to hold because of its raised sharp edges so I have to hold it a different way and it is tiring. I did not have this issue with my Oasis 1 which felt fantastic in my hand. The other disappointment is the battery life. I wish Amazon would quit pushing the "long" battery life as it raises expectations it can't fullfill. I decided to keep the Oasis 2 mainly because of the audiobook capability.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy S. Umbehagen

customer_reviews.title: Major Disapointment!!
customer_reviews.text: Piece of junk, had mine 6 wks and it quit working, locked up, pages would turn, couldn't turn it off either. Luckily I bought a 2 yr insurance on it, its being returned for credit, $329 and it quits in 6 wks! First kindle lasted almost 5 yrs, 2nd lasted 2 yrs! Seems Amazon might want to find a new supplier!
customer_reviews.author: Laurel M Brown

customer_reviews.title: W
customer_reviews.text: With every update it is cluttered with 11 new user guides. Highlight function is awful. Plan on restarting ever few days. Good luck finding clipping and notes easily. This technology is so rudementary it seems like something from the DOS era. Except for the screen sharpness (which is good) it is more cumbersome than my first Kindle in 2005.
customer_reviews.author: Dorsay

customer_reviews.title: Seems like a step backwards
customer_reviews.text: I got the original Oasis shortly after it came out and love it still . So when I saw this new version I spent all my Christmas giftcards on it. I ordered with it a skin, one of the MoKo case's and a ring phone holder. After 2 week's with the device I am glad I did not sell my old one on Craigslist. I always loved the small form of the original as I could slip it in my jacket pocket and it has lost something gaining the larger inch.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed...very poor battery life.
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed by my Oasis...the battery life is truly very poor, not near what was advertised, and the unit self-discharges at an alarming rate when turned off. When it sits around for 1 week, the battery is empty. Not sure whether this is normal or whether I have a defective unit, but at this price, it is a massive disappointment. I expected better from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Bernhard Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother with the Oasis and Amazons policies stink.
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from an Paperwhite to an Oasis thinking it would be a world better, but its really the same thing but more awkward to hold. I purchased this item in May and now the price was reduced $50. Just a month after I purchased it. Amazon would not price match. They gave me a $15 credit towards any Amazon product. This is my 4th Kindle product and I am a dedicated customer. I don't feel the need to be so dedicated now, since they can't part with $50. It's may fault for spending the crazy $349.00 (plus insurance $30) for this item.
customer_reviews.author: Goldie

customer_reviews.title: You can't get a cup of tea big enough or a book long enough to suit me.
customer_reviews.text: If I own any device that I love, it is this one. Upgraded from a Paperwhite because, well, I'm frickin' fancy like that. If you are new to Kindle let me just say, this will change your bookish life. A whole world of books right in one small place that fits comfortably in your hands. Make sure to get Libby on your smart device and link your library card and kindle so you can check out e-books for free! The Oasis is great for reading poolside, in a bath or if you're like me in the shower. Yeah we take this ish serious in my house!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Love the Oasis as a Device, Hate the Short Battery Life
customer_reviews.text: The Kindle Oasis has a great look and great feel -- I like to walk and read, so I especially appreciate the physical buttons to allow one to turn a page (an easier and more economical motion than the swipe). However, I have been very unhappily surprised by the short battery life. With the Oasis set on "airplane" mode and in its resting screen mode the Oasis has been losing battery life extremely quickly (like 25% overnight not even being in active mode). I resorted to ordering a an older model "Kindle Keyboard" off Ebay to have a backup devices with longer battery life (because I have a morbid fear of being stuck on a plane with a dead e-reader).
customer_reviews.author: Red Sox Reader

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but beautiful!
customer_reviews.text: I have only owned an original Paperwhite that I got second hand and it had some damage to the screen so getting this was a huge upgrade. The Oasis is a beautiful e-reader. Very light and very comfortable to hold. I really like the wider screen too. It's slightly bigger left to right compared to the Paperwhite but neither one can really comfortably go into a pocket so it doesn't bother me. I can say that it is very expensive and I don't really know it's that much better than the newer Paperwhite but I just wanted to get the best one so I can enjoy it for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: B. Riebe

customer_reviews.title: Comfortably
customer_reviews.text: This is simply a GREAT e-reader. I have owned it for a few weeks and can not find any faults with it. Great contrast indoors, outdoors, bright sun to lights out at bedtime. The page turn buttons enable true one handed reading. The cell connection is flawless and now that I have it I would never consider going without. If you are on the fence, go for it. You will not be disappointed with the Oasis.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: So happy I got this!!
customer_reviews.text: I have the Kindle Voyage and I love it. It started draining too quickly so I looked into buying a replacement battery and saw all the great reviews online about the Oasis. I always wished my Voyage was waterproof so I ordered it right away. Then I started reading the Amazon reviews and almost cancelled it. I’m so glad I didn’t. It’s amazing and although I’m keeping both, the Oasis, for me, is the better of the 2. I had no problems accessing my books and the display is easier to read. If you’re having doubts, take a chance. I think you’ll love it.
customer_reviews.author: M.G.

customer_reviews.title: Great size to take wherever you go !
customer_reviews.text: I’m a long time a kindle customer and have been very satisfied with all my past E-readers. This one is no exception. Easy to use and very clear text and a nice size. Also enjoying the page buttons, seem to work better than the touch method. This also marks my return to black and white, just don’t need color (kindle fire) for reading. No complaint about the kindle fire, but for reading I like this better
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: This e-reader is performing reasonably well. My last Kindle was a Voyage, and I wasn't sure I'd like the larger shape of the Oasis, but it has been fine. The battery runs down much more quickly than the Voyage, which is disappointing as I was under the impression it would last longer. I have to charge it at least once a week, where as I could get 2 weeks with the other one. I haven't dropped it in water to test whether it is actually waterproof. I'll just hope it is. I think that I like reading this Kindle better due to the larger screen.
customer_reviews.author: S. Towner

customer_reviews.title: Has some problems
customer_reviews.text: I love the ease of holding the Oasis and the fact the screen will turn around if you want the button on the other side. The print is very clear and the light is easy to raise or lower. The battery does not last as long as they say. Maybe if you only read for a couple hours a day. I have days where I read much longer than that. My main complaint is the screen freezes up.It has only happened twice so far and if I turn it off then back on it clears so far. If this continues I will have to send it back to be fixed or replaced.
customer_reviews.author: sling

customer_reviews.title: So light and easy!
customer_reviews.text: The reader exceeds my expectations. Love love love! I had a large tablet which was so heavy you could not even hold it up. I can read clearly, turn pages very easily, two ways to turn pages. Very easy to use which I wanted. I just wanted something I could take everywhere, fit in most my purses, even water-resistant, so easy to get to home page, settings, just my kind of reader. I am a book person, however, with this I was able to make the switch. I am happy with the bigger screen on the new one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent design with options!
customer_reviews.text: A new way of adding and storing books, PDFs, and manuals all in one spot! My only fault with this is looking at your inventory. They advertise the store books along with your own books. It would be great if they had it setup where you can look at an expanded view of all your own books alone without getting them confused with the store books. Great new device with incredible battery life and a sleek futuristic design. The size is just right and not overbearing at all. A great product with the option to add your own library, if you like.
customer_reviews.author: MrJob

customer_reviews.title: Worth the extra money
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with this eReader now that it plays Audible! They still need to work on the battery life for us hardcore readers. It sometimes does fly out of my hands because it's slick so I recommend a case for a grip. You can reverse the buttons as to which goes forward a page in which goes back, which I love. You can add fonts. This is by far the best Kindle that they have made and worth the extra money!
customer_reviews.author: Mystery Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Love the gripping edge 'handle'!!
customer_reviews.text: I take this on airlines when I travel and couldn't be happier. The paperwhite is terrific (no reaching for that overhead light) and with the gripping edge, it is so easy to hold and read. The only problem is with the cover - if you fold it backwards, it lies flat and you lose the gripping edge. I'm still unsure about Goodreads, and I'm still trying to figure out what amazon prime benefits I have if any, but so far, so good! If you are considering between the Oasis and the regular Kindle, the main difference is the up/down side buttons and the gripping edge, so if you don't need those, the regular Kindle is terrific also.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: worth the price if you are an avid reader
customer_reviews.text: For the most part I like it; The screen size is better and I love holding it with one hand. I also love having the page turning buttons. The waterproof feature is great-i already used it by the pool and it got wet and no problem now for the bad. With a price tag of 340 for an e-reader--give the customer a wall plug in adapter and take away the advertisements if the customer doesn't want them.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Best Kindle yet
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad Amazon ditched the charging cover. I've had the 1st and 2nd gen Paperwhite, Voyage, Oasis (first-gen) and now the 2nd-gen Oasis which is by far the best. So happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simply the best e-reader.
customer_reviews.text: This is simply the best e-reader that has ever existed. I read a lot, and with my Kindle, I can take my whole library with me anywhere. Because it's waterproof, I read by the pool without worrying about it getting wet. I also buy Audible books on my Kindle and listen to them through my Bluetooth devices. I also love the Word Wise feature where my Kindle will read to me. I love the 7" display. It's easier to read than the smaller 6" displays of previous Kindles. Amazon invented the e-reader and if you want the best e-reader, the Oasis is the only choice.
customer_reviews.author: Joey A. Eagan

customer_reviews.title: I love my new Oasis
customer_reviews.text: Having used the device, I agree with the tech reviews...the Kindle Oasis is the best E-reader out there. Upgrading from an early Paperwhite, I love the larger screen, physical buttons and asymmetric design that places the weight in the palm of your hand where it belongs. I wish the screen had a bit more contrast - deeper blacks. A quick fix I found is that increasing the boldness of the fonts helps readability significantly.
customer_reviews.author: MyDigitaLife

customer_reviews.title: I am disappointed to be sending such a nice device
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed to be sending such a nice device. But I do feel it is warranted, and I don't recommend this to anyone. Even if you don't think you would use immersion reading, I still think you should expect to have the option on a device this expensive; consider that it already has Audible support. The $80 Kindle does this, the $350 Kindle does not, sadly.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Great Upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Have owned numerous Kindles to include the Oasis I. Admittedly I was uncertain about investing in the Oasis II but I was intrigued by the bigger screen. Thus far I'm very happy I made the investment. The device is a pleasure to hold and read. I especially enjoy the greater number of LED lights as it appears more uniform and overall brighter than previous Kindles. The additional reading space makes for a more pleasant experience for me and I enjoy getting lost in the books I'm reading. Haven't used the audible portion yet but it's terrific to have the option.
customer_reviews.author: Viper

customer_reviews.title: AII - New Kindle Oasis E-reader
customer_reviews.text: I had the first edition of the Oasis E-reader. This edition is a big improvement. It is larger and has many new features. The battery frequently disconnected from the first E-reader, but the new one seems to prevent that from happening. I especially like the fact that I can use it with Audible. I like to read in the car when we are traveling. The glare from the sun does not affect the reader, and the light at night can be adjusted. In fact, I can adjust the print so that I don’t have to wear my glasses. I highly recommend the new Oasis!
customer_reviews.author: Mae

customer_reviews.title: Love my Kindle Oasis
customer_reviews.text: So far I am loving my new Kindle Oasis. I still have the original Kindle Fire and that is working great, however it is so heavy and I can’t read it outside, so it was time for an upgrade. My husband talked me into upgrading and I am so glad he did. I have no issues with the Kindle Oasis. I did order a skin from another site and really like the look of the skin plus it makes the Kindle Oasis not as slippery.
customer_reviews.author: best mom

customer_reviews.title: Ugh.  Won’t charge from day one.
customer_reviews.text: This was my 6th kindle. Out of the box, it took 23 hours to charge to 86% and one hour to drain to nothing. The only one still working properly is my Kindle Keyboard. I don’t know what’s happened to kindles but it’s been non-stop disappoint. Two paper whites that lasted less than a year. The first Oasis lasted 6 months, this one lasted one day. I have a regular kindle and a keyboard that still work but all the newer ones have been utter garbage. So bummed.
customer_reviews.author: Erin B

customer_reviews.title: Voyage offers a better reading experience
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the 32GB storage capacity, trading in my long-beloved Touch (reluctantly). IMHO the Voyage model is easier on the eyes as well as to use. The Touch also included TTS (text-to-speech) but few newer Kindle titles enabled the option anyway. Had I had the option of adding microSD card storage expansion to my previous Kindles I never would have purchased this. I wish it had an option to "download entire library"; 1-by-1 is *extremely* tedious...
customer_reviews.author: David B. Huber

customer_reviews.title: Perfect reading device.
customer_reviews.text: So far the Oasis is completely meeting my expectations. I'm in love with the feel of the kindle. I love the size. Mostly I love the font. It is crisp and clear. I have owned the Paperwhite, Voyage and the Oasis. By far it is my favorite Kindle I have owned. I admit this is probably best for a serious reader or someone that has vision that requires a crisp font.
customer_reviews.author: Champ

customer_reviews.title: Mixed bag.
customer_reviews.text: I like the quality of the reader. It's well built and it's somewhat easy to hold as long as I have a case. However, I didn't actually know until now, being this is my first Kindle, that I don't actually own the books that I buy. They are locked down and I can only read them on approved devices. This is a terrible decision by Amazon and I'm not impressed. The other thing is the batter can run rampart for no apparent reason. Sometimes it's great and other times it's sucks 5 percent an hour.
customer_reviews.author: JRobert

customer_reviews.title: Updated
customer_reviews.text: Update** Amazon reached out right away after this review, I still had two days on my warranty and a new one is in the mail. I do like the device, just was disappointed in battery. Still wish it was longer lasting but the auto-brightness can kill it fast! This thing is way overpriced. Battery is dying on me within a year of purchase and isn't that great anyways. I'd get one of the cheaper ones unless there is some random feature you MUST have.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Here’s My 2 Cents
customer_reviews.text: I like this new reader’s features with the exception of the off set boarder. It just seems awkward to me. I’m constantly having to turn it upside down to change hands. It should have equal boarders on both sides, just wide enough for a firm one handed grip. Oh and I kinda of like the Voyge page turning controls better then this Oasis.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: love the larger screen
customer_reviews.text: I love the larger screen. It is very sensitive, just moving a finger over the screen, not even touching the screen will turn the page. I bought it so I could listen to audio books but find the price of audio books is expensive. I was disappointed that the " Audible" does not work like the Kindle Unlimited. Overall I am happy with the Oasis.
customer_reviews.author: V. Wedg

customer_reviews.title: What a Great Device! If you like to read you will love it!
customer_reviews.text: I used the Kindle software on my Samsung Tablet/Laptop combo. It was great until I got out in the sun. So I bought the Kindle Oasis. What a difference! You can read it anywhere. It's very customer friendly. I love the size - very convenient. I take it everywhere so I can read if I have to wait. I absolutely love it. It's so great to carry around a library of fifty books using only a small percentage of available space. I can't imagine anyone not loving this device. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Lew Early

customer_reviews.title: Love device but loathed default Home screen enough I started a return until figured out
customer_reviews.text: I liked the idea of adding waterproof protection and reinstating audio. But, I honestly nearly returned when help options on website could not show me how to get rid of home screen showing all the bookcovers of Amazon recommendations plus huge bookcover of most recent download and a column of my wishlisted books . I'm an experienced kindle user and I want to see my currently reading book on home page rather than recommendations. Ddudn't want extra menu to click to get to "my library" -- eventually found under settings and am back to familiar kindle home screen. Wasn't in the included user's guide.
customer_reviews.author: C. Rice

customer_reviews.title: So many ways to customize!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS KINDLE!!!!!!! I love that I can adjust the font size, the font boldness, the line spacing and the margin width. I have some vision issues and LOVE to read. This has been such a huge blessing to me!! I also LOVE that I can purchase audible books!
customer_reviews.author: Debbie L. Morris

customer_reviews.title: Oasis vs Paperwhite
customer_reviews.text: I had thought my oasis had stopped working so I purchased a paperwhite. After using both I like the oasis better . Because it has a larger screen and page buttons. Plus the design allows one to hold it without touching the screen. often if you touch the screen accidently it will change the page. The one advantage the paperwhite has it that it is lighter. For me the oasis is well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Battery life leaves a lot to be desired.
customer_reviews.text: Overall, it's a decent E-reader. Battery life, however, leaves a lot to be desired. The user manual claims that when the device is in screen saver mode, that it uses no power. This is incorrect. Even when I use the screen off power option, the battery is down by several percentage points the next time I activate the device. At the rate it burns through battery power, a full recharge lasts mere days, not weeks. Perhaps I'm missing something, but so far as I can tell, there's no way to fully turn this device off, so it's constantly draining the battery. Very poor design choice on Amazon's part.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Heavilin

customer_reviews.title: Move over Paperwhite there’s a new Kindle in town
customer_reviews.text: I often told people that I would NEVER get rid of my Paperwhite. When I saw that Amazon offered a Kindle that had Bluetooth capability for audible books, I decided to give it a try. As soon as I opened the box and tried the Oasis, I was hooked. The next day I retired my Paperwhite for good. The Oasis has extremely clear text and, like I mentioned, Bluetooth which was very easy to set up. The response time on uploading books, turning pages, etc. is much improved from the old versions. Could not have been happier with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: suvata

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, but quite nice device.
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice device. Perfect high resolution screen with ultra smooth lighting. Page turns are seamlessly fast while the operating system appears to be quite stable. Very comfortable to hold in my hand for extended periods of reading. I got the 32 Gb and 4G no ads option for mine. Somewhat pricey...but seems thus far to be worth every penny. However, avoid the "premium" cases. I got the leather case and it scratches very easily and barely holds onto the device and does not cover it completely.
customer_reviews.author: Henry A

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BOTHER, waste of money...horrible product.
customer_reviews.text: Not waterproof at all, died on me after I took it out to read a raft, with not even that much water submerged. For the money, this is egregious and they need to fix it or stop claiming it’s waterproof, because I’ve had it for more than year now, I can’t return it or exchange it...so I’m screwed. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY on this overpriced piece of junk....on my first vacation in 5 years and my main reader is done after barely being in the water, so I am LIVID!!!!! Shame on Amazon for peddling this crap, and charging so much for it.
customer_reviews.author: MJM

customer_reviews.title: Battery charge only lasts about an hour
customer_reviews.text: Very crisp text & reading detail. Device is heavy to hold. Battery runs down after only an hour of use. My precious kindles lasted much longer. Magnetic cover slides all over the place
customer_reviews.author: laura

customer_reviews.title: Battery does NOT last weeks
customer_reviews.text: Great reader, the screen is fantastic, but it’s a complete fabrication that the battery lasts weeks. I have the 4g 32gb version, mostly I have WiFi and Bluetooth on, and I am lucky if the battery lasts 2 days sometimes. This is extremely disappointing as I bought it for long flights, and in the evening sometimes I will read for 3 hours before I sleep, I am a voracious reader, I have over 400 books on this kindle, and I thought I had finally found the best kindle reader.
customer_reviews.author: PhilD

customer_reviews.title: You can find magic wherever you look. Sit back and relax, all you need is a book.” Dr. Seuss
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Kindle and I do love it however I really wish it used the newer type C charger connection. ( type C plugs in up or down)The type is so clear and easy to look at for long periods. The battery life will not be "weeks" if you read a lot as I do, however it is more than enough to be manageable. I wish I had known that when the screen flashes black it is simply refreshing. The Kindle community quickly educated me. Don't forget to check out the overdrive app through your library. They have a great Kindle selection. Peace.
customer_reviews.author: daVid

customer_reviews.title: Worth the wait for the new Oasis
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with the new Oasis E-reader. I have had a Voyage for years and thought it was enough, but liked the idea of audio with the new Oasis so purchased. Not disappointed. The sizing is wider than the Voyage, but the weight and feel in my hand is very comfortable. I like the brighter screen back-lighting and the raised page-turn buttons. I did need to get use to the forward turn being the upper button. Actually, once I started reading on the Oasis, I have had no interest in going back to the Voyage. Nice upgrade!
customer_reviews.author: M. Bast

customer_reviews.title: The best for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I got the closeout sale when the best "Ferrari" model of Kindle Oasis 2 was on sale for $150. It was an absolute steal! The battery life lacks a lot, true, but on airplane mode, it wasn't actually too bad. I think the buttons are an absolute blessing and I like it loads better than my old, old Kindle model.
customer_reviews.author: Elena Lee

customer_reviews.title: Water proof
customer_reviews.text: Like the look and feel but battery life is not what I expected. They say it will last longer with wifi off but should you really have to turn everything off all the time in order to last more then 8 hours. Come on Amazon I expect better given the price and your long history with kindles.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great improvement with just a couple of caveats
customer_reviews.text: Love how lightweight the device is, and screen quality & battery life are excellent. The form factor presents some difficulty, as the lower corner digs into your hand when using the device one-handed. Some type of rubber bumper or pad on the bottom corners would be of great benefit. In addition, it's easy to accidentally change pages if your thumb creeps over to the active portion of the screen (disclaimer: I have large hands). All in all I am very pleased with the purchase and the new Oasis is a great advancement in the product line. /TCPilot
customer_reviews.author: TCPilot

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Loving it so much so far! Even with the sometimes glitchy backlight. (Often I have to restart my kindle for the backlight to turn on). The free cellular option is definitely the way to go! It’s so thintastic and the touch screen is more responsive than my previous kindles. I also love the page turn buttons.
customer_reviews.author: Sailorcallisto

customer_reviews.title: This is my third Kindle.
customer_reviews.text: I started with the first one out. Then I had the Kindle Keyboard. I still struggle with this one. I like that it has buttons. I like that I can hold it in my left or right hand. But I pine for my Kindle Keyboard. I used it so much, my buttons wore out and I knew it was time for a new one. But, like many a lost love, I still yearn for the old, while making due with the new.
customer_reviews.author: BB

product_meta.title: Kindle Oasis E-reader (Previous Generation - 9th) - Graphite, 7" High-Resolution Display (300 ppi), Waterproof, Built-In Audible, 32 GB, Wi-Fi + Free Cellular Connectivity (Closeout)
feature_bullets: Now available in Graphite or Champagne Gold.
Our largest, highest resolution display— 7” and 300 ppi, reads like real paper without glare, even in bright sunlight.
The first waterproof (IPX8) Kindle so you are free to read in even more places.
Now with Audible, listen to the world’s largest library of audiobooks. Pair with Bluetooth to take the story with you anytime, anywhere.
Thin and light ergonomic design with dedicated page turn buttons and adaptive front light so you can read even more comfortably for hours.
Keep reading—a single charge lasts weeks, not hours.
Enjoy twice the storage with 8 GB. Or choose 32 GB to hold more magazines, comics, newspapers, and audiobooks.
Instant access to new releases and bestsellers, or over a million titles at $2.99 or less. Prime members read free with unlimited access to over a thousand titles.
